gov.nih.nlm.meme.client
Class ClientAPI

java.lang.Object
  gov.nih.nlm.meme.client.ClientAPI
Direct Known Subclasses:
ActionClient, AdminClient, AuxiliaryDataClient, ConceptMappingClient, ContentViewClient, CoreDataClient, DummyClient, EditingClient, FinderClient, LogClient, MaintenanceClient, MEMERelaEditorKit, MergeEngineClient, ReleaseClient, ReportsClient, WorklistClient
public class ClientAPI
extends Object

This class is the generic superclass for all client API's.. Any client side API written should extend this class as it manages the connection to the server. To correctly interact with this class, subclasses should always call super() in their constructors, and should initiate processing of their requests by using getRequestHandler(). For example, 

  public class SomeClientAPI extends ClientAPI {

    public SomeClientAPI() { super(); }

    public Object clientAPIMethod() {
      MEMEServiceRequest request = new MEMEServiceRequest();
      // set parameters of service request
      request.addParameter(new Parameter("name","value"));

      // handle request (this connects to the server)
      request = getRequestHandler().processRequest(request);

      // deal with results
      ...
    >
  }
In order for this class to be used, three properties must be set in the MEMEToolkit. They are:
  • meme.client.server.host - the machine currently running the MEMEApplicationServer
  • meme.client.server.port - the port that the MEME Application Server is listening on
  • meme.client.protocol.class - the class implementing MEMERequestClient which is used to communicate with the server
The best approach to ensure these properties are set is to use the properties file $MEME_HOME/bin/meme.prop. This file is a releasable component in MEME4 and should be properly configured at all times. To make use of this file, either invoke java with the parameter -Dmeme.properties.file=$MEME_HOME/bin/meme.prop or use the $MEME_HOME/bin/memerun.pl wrapper script.

Author:
MEME Group

Constructor Detail

ClientAPI

public ClientAPI()
          throws MEMEException
Instantiates a ClientAPI that will generate reports from the default mid service (editing-db). This constructor requires three properties to be set: meme.client.protocol.class, meme.client.server.host, meme.client.server.port

Throws:
MEMEException - if connection could not be opened. or if the protocol handler cannot be instantiated.
